courses.title: SDMX Foundation Course
courses.summary: The course is divided into 2 modules. Module 1 provides a high-level introduction to SDMX and its benefits. Module 2 explains SDMX concepts in more detail, providing actual data producers, handlers, and users (e.g., statisticians and IT practitioners) a theoretical understanding of how SDMX works.

courses.title: SDMX Tools Course
courses.summary: The course is divided into 2 modules. Module 1 provide participants an overview of SDMX tools for common scenarios or use cases. Module 2 provides an overview of the features and demonstrations on how to use (1) SDMX Constructor, (2) Fusion Metadata Registry, and (3) SDMX Converter for selected use cases.

courses.title: Running Fusion Metadata Registry in Docker
courses.summary: A simple and quick way to get started with Fusion Metadata Registry in 10 minutes.

courses.title: Fusion Metadata Registry beginners hands on
courses.summary: A 1h30m webinar recording introducing Fusion Metadata Registry for beginners

courses.title: Validating SDMX data using Fusion Metadata Registry
courses.summary: A 1h30m webinar recording exploring how Fusion Metadata Registry can be used to structurally validate SDMX datasets

courses.title: Fusion Metadata Registry - data collection using Excel templates
courses.summary: A 1h30m webinar recording exploring how Fusion Metadata Registry's Excel reporting templates feature can simplify data collection

courses.title: Essential SDMX Structural Modelling
courses.summary: This course aims to provide you with the knowledge and skills to transform and map statistical logical models to the SDMX standard.

courses.title: Introduction to Structural Modelling for Statisticians
courses.summary: This course aims to provide you with an understanding of and ability to create structural models of statistical data.

courses.title: SDMX data conversion fundamentals using Fusion Metadata Registry
courses.summary: This course explores how to convert datasets to different transmission formats interactively using the FMR web user interface.

courses.title: Essential SDMX and the Fusion Metadata Registry (FMR)
courses.summary: Building upon the knowledge and skills previously acquired regarding SDMX structural modelling, this module introduces practical knowledge on how to create and manage an SDMX structural model using the Fusion Metadata Registry (FMR).

courses.title: Fusion Metadata Registry (FMR) Pro Tips
courses.summary: The Fusion Metadata Registry (FMR) is a SDMX v2.0, v2.1, and v3.0 compliant structural metadata registry with an extensive set of features. This module is a collection of tips to highlight some of these capabilities and practical ideas on how to use the tool to accomplish your structural metadata maintenance tasks in an efficient manner.

courses.title: Recoding: Transforming Data into Different Structures
courses.summary: Throughout their lifecycle, data are subjected to many operations and transformations as they are massaged, aggregated, summarised, analysed, and customised for a wide range of outputs. The primary focus of this module is on recoding data using the SDMX standard and Fusion Metadata Registry (FMR).

courses.title: Data Collection with XLSX Templates: All about XLSX Templates
courses.summary: Statistical agencies, Central Banks, and other data-driven organisations need to collect data. MS Excel is a common tool used for this purpose. Metadata driven MS XLSX documents enable data collectors to design and run efficient data collection processes in accordance with the SDMX structural model. This approach makes it easier to validate, to integrate these data into production workflows, and to improve data quality.

courses.title: Crash course on SDMX
courses.summary: To enable participants to gain a general understanding of the SDMX standard and the most common SDMX artefacts that support the reporting, exchange and dissemination of statistical data.

courses.title: SDMX Basics
courses.summary: This course will help you understand the scope, architecture, and features of SDMX, in particular those features that support more efficient processes for reporting, exchanging and disseminating statistical data and metadata.

courses.title: Euro-SDMX Registry
courses.summary: This course will help you to manage and store SDMX artefacts using the graphical user interface of the Euro SDMX Registry.

courses.title: SDMX Converter
courses.summary: This course enables participants to learn about the SDMX Converter, one of the tools Eurostat developed to support its implementation of the SDMX standard for the exchange and validation of data.

courses.title: SDMX for Labour Statistics
courses.summary: The objective of the course is to enable participants to understand the scope, architecture and features of SDMX, in particular those features that support more efficient processes for reporting, exchanging and disseminating statistical data and metadata.

courses.title: An introduction to SDMX for data producers
courses.summary: In this course, you will learn about the Statistical Data and Metadata eXchange standard and how it is applied in the .Stat Suite context.

courses.title: SDMX vocabulary for beginners
courses.summary: In this course, you will learn about routine SDMX vocabulary to describe and define statistical data tables.

courses.topic: SDMX data modelling, .Stat Suite, SDMX Matrix Generator
courses.title: An introduction to SDMX structural modelling for data producers
courses.summary: In this course, you will learn about the Statistical Data and Metadata eXchange data modelling and how to practically apply it in the .Stat Suite context.

courses.title: SDMX vocabulary for data managers
courses.summary: In this course, you will further extend your understanding of basic SDMX terms for general data related processes.

courses.title: Disseminating data with an optimised end-user experience
courses.summary: In this course, you will learn best practices to optimise the user experience of data disseminated with the .Stat Suite Data Explorer.

courses.title: Creating and applying mappings for the .Stat Suite
courses.summary: In this course you will learn about creating and applying mappings in SDMX using FMR and the .Stat Suite.

courses.title: SDMX for the Sustainable Development Goals
courses.summary: This course is designed to support data producers/compilers at the national, regional and global levels in modelling and sharing Sustainable Development Goals (SDG) data following the SDMX standard.
